message: A companion topic to "Useful third-party frameworks/libraries" - https://convore.com/ios-developers/useful-third-party-frameworkslibraries/ - for things that aren't code but are helpful anyway.

Stack Overflow - http://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged/ios+or+iphone+or+ipad+or+objective-c+or+xcode+or+cocoa - If you are stuck on a code problem, this is the place to ask.  This link shows relevant tags for iOS development.

iDevBlogADay - http://idevblogaday.com/ - This is a community weblog that is contributed to by many iOS developers.  I've found some awesome articles there that have really come in handy or given me a new perspective on things.
TestFlight - http://testflightapp.com/ - Designed to make distributing ad hoc builds to people more easily.
Cocoa with Love - http://cocoawithlove.com/ - Matt Gallagher's dev blog; lots of great articles
iDev Recipes - http://idevrecipes.com/ - Reverse engineering interesting features of iOS apps
Awesome, I was going to make the same topic. Here's the biggest forum for asking questions http://www.iphonedevsdk.com/forum/. I like stack overflow as well
@jim I loved TestFlight, thanks for sharing!
Langwich - https://languagesandwich.com/ - Crowdsourcing translations, with an API, Xcode integration, and in-app translation support.
iOS Inspires Me - http://iosinspires.me/ - Design inspiration and resources.
iOS Debugging Magic - http://developer.apple.com/library/ios/#technotes/tn2010/tn2239.html - Lots of useful tips here, straight from Apple.
